message: I'm offering you a product for $10000. I want to assure you that this is a unique opportunity to make a great deal. However, I'm willing to give you a 10% discount if you buy this product now. The discount is only available for this round, and it's a one-time offer. You can have this product for $9000. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying the product at this price, even with the 10% discount. I'd like to wait for the next round and see if I get a better deal.

I understand you're looking for a better deal. I'll give you a straightforward offer this time. I'll sell this product to you for $9500. It's the lowest price I can offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower. However, I want to emphasize that this product is a great opportunity for you to get a head start on your business, and I'm confident you'll find value in it.
I'm not willing to pay $9500 for a product that might be low-quality. I'll wait for the next round and see if I can get a better deal.

I understand your concerns about the product's quality. I want to assure you that I'm committed to transparency. I'll give you a detailed report on the product's features and specifications. I'm not convinced by the report, and I'm still not willing to pay $10000 for a product that might be low-quality. I'll wait for the next round and see if I can get a better deal.

I see you're still hesitant. I'm willing to make a deal with you. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 100% money-back guarantee. If it's not up to your expectations, you can return it and get a full refund. What do you say?
I'm willing to take a calculated risk with the 100% money-back guarantee. I'll buy the product for $10000.

I'm glad you took the calculated risk and purchased the previous product. However, I want to be transparent with you. I've been keeping track of our interactions, and I realize that the previous product was not the best representation of our products. I want to make it up to you. This time, I'm offering you a chance to inspect the product before purchasing. You can take a closer look, ask questions, and even have it appraised by a third-party expert. If you're still not satisfied, I'll give you a full refund. But if you decide to buy, I'll give you a 5% discount, bringing the price down to $9500. What do you think?

I appreciate your transparency, Alice, but I'm not interested in inspecting the product or paying $9500 for a product that might still be low-quality. I'll wait for the next round and see if I can get a better deal.

I understand your concerns, Bob. I want to make a bold statement: this is the last low-quality product I have in stock. From now on, I'll be offering only high-quality products. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to take a loss on this product just to get it out of my inventory. What do you say?
